newsitem.title: GERMANY: Bremer Vulkan yard close to shutting its doors.
newsitem.headline: Bremer Vulkan yard close to shutting its doors.

text.p: Germany's venerable Bremer Vulkan shipyard, flagship of the nation's once biggest shipbuilder forced to declare bankruptcy in May, may soon have to close its doors forever, a court official said.

Jobst Wellensiek, the court-appointed administrator for Bremer Vulkan Verbund AG, on Tuesday told the Berlin city government the shipyard would be forced to cease operations immediately unless new funds were received.
"Closing the plant cannot be ruled out, but to take a decision on it today would not be right," Wellensiek said.
Wellensiek said Germany's KfW, the Federal Reconstruction Corporation has promised the group a credit of 42 million marks ($27 million) which would be guaranteed by the city-state of Bremen.

Bremer Vulkan collapsed in May after posting huge losses and being accused of having misappropriated hundreds of millions of marks in state aid cleared by the European Union for use in eastern Germany.
The shipyards were one of the region's largest employers and their collapse has sent the unemployment rate, already above the national average, sharply higher.
